{"asin": "B004OA0872", "description": "Our Bee Sunny mineral sunblock is a great way to create protection while outdoors.  It is easy to apply and very effective.  Just apply in a grid pattern to ensure even coverage.\nWe changed to new packaging February 2014 and the formula has twice the blocking power.\n\nRecommended by the skin cancer foundation as a superior UV sunscreen.\n\nThe combination of uva and uvb broad spectrum sunscreen coverage comes for 34% active ingredients including Zinc and Titanium.  \n\nZinc is an essential mineral required by the body for maintaining a sense of smell, keeping a healthy immune system, building proteins, triggering enzymes, and creating DNA. Zinc also helps the cells in your body communicate by functioning as a neurotransmitter. A deficiency in zinc can lead to stunted growth, diarrhea, impotence, hair loss, eye and skin lesions, impaired appetite, and depressed immunity.\n\nTitanium Dioxide or titanium (IV) oxide or titania, is a substance that occurs naturally as three mineral compounds known as anatase, brookite, and rutile.  It is most commonly extracted from titanium tetrachloride by carbon reduction and re-oxidization. It has very high refraction properties. In fact, titanium dioxide is one of the whitest materials known to exist on Earth. It reflects light away from the skin. Cheaply produced, higher SPF sunscreens are juiced up with chemical absorbers. That means harmful UV rays have the opportunity to get into your skin, where the chemicals trap it and \"trick\" your skin into thinking it's not going to burn. These products were developed in the 1980's with the use of outdoor testing in Hawaii under Ultra Violet radiation (UV) conditions more intense than in the U.S. mainland. UV radiation is one of the most important factors in the development of risk\nfor skin cancer. Bonding Base Sun Blocks feature a unique technology that allows the lotion to attach\nto the skin and therefore resist water and physical abrasion. This allows the products to remain on the skin much longer than non-bonding base sunscreens. They provide UVA and UVB protection,and are hypoallergenic, waterproof, greaseless, and fragrance free.\n\nStringent Testing - The Bonding Base Sun Blocks are included in stringent testing programs. They are tested routinely as part of an ongoing stability program and have proven to be stable for a minimum of five years. (118 ml) Aubrey Organics Natural Sun Green Tea High Protection Sunscreen is Aubrey Organics' richest antioxidant blend. Aubrey Organics Natural Sun Green Tea High Protection Sunscreen is an intensive, protective formula that prevents free radical damage and fights the aging effects of sun exposure and pollution with organic green tea and herbal skin conditioners. Aubrey Organics Natural Sun Green Tea High Protection Sunscreen provides SPF 30+ protection from UVB and UVA rays. Aubrey Organics Natural Sun Green Tea High Protection Sunscreen's higher SPF gives more sunburn protection. Aubrey Organics Natural Sun Green Tea High Protection Sunscreen helps prevent sunburn. When do I need sun protection? The real answer is: any time you're outside. It's important to remember that sun protection isn't just for days at the beach. Sun damage can happen whenever you come in contact with harmful UV raysthat includes when you are out walking the dog or driving in your car, early or late in the day when the sun is low, or even on overcast days. &nbsp; Remember: when you are fully dressed, your hands and face are still exposed, so a little daily sun protection is a good idea. The most dangerous time to be outdoors without proper protection is between 10 AM and 3 PM, when the sun is at its peak. It is safest to stay indoors during those hours, but if you go outside, be sure to wear protective clothing or use a high SPF sunscreen and reapply it frequently and liberally. (One ounce of sunscreen, enough to fill a shotglass, should cover most exposed skin.) &nbsp; What is an SPF? SPF, or Sun Protection Factor, is a rating system that determines how long a sunscreen protects your skin from the sun's UVB rays. The SPF number is a measure of how much longer you can stay in the sun without burning while using a sunscreen versus how long you can stay without burning while wearing NO sun protection."}
